meanings.definition: Damaged or weakened, especially gradually or insidiously.
meanings.sent2: The undermined structure was no longer safe to enter.
meanings.sent3: The undermined chair creaked ominously under the weight of the person sitting on it.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like an undermined building, shaky and uncertain.
meanings.sent5: The undermined tree swayed dangerously in the wind, ready to fall at any moment.

meanings.definition: To dig or tunnel beneath (something) in order to weaken or destroy it.
meanings.sent1: The criminals undermined the bank vault to steal the treasure.
meanings.sent2: The workers undermined the old building to make space for a new construction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit undermined the garden fence, escaping into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: His constant lies undermined the trust his friends had in him.
meanings.sent5: The spy undermined the enemy's defense by secretly sabotaging their communication lines.

meanings.definition: To lessen the effectiveness, power, or ability of (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The lack of sleep undermined his performance in the exam.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments undermined her self-confidence.
meanings.sent3: The rain undermined the sandcastle, causing it to collapse.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by his closest friend undermined his trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The virus undermined the computer system, causing it to crash unexpectedly.
